N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4700.3 - Payroll records

State Regulations
(a) On behalf
of the authority, the fiscal officer shall maintain and make available for
inspection and copying at the authority's main office a current list setting
forth the name, public office address, title and salary of every officer or
employee of the authority. (b) All
requests to inspect and/or copy the payroll records of the authority shall be
made to the fiscal officer. Such request shall be made either orally or in
writing; provided, however, that the fiscal officer may require the applicant
to confirm his request in writing on a form prescribed by the Comptroller of
the State of New York. (c) Upon
receipt of an application to inspect the payroll of the authority, on the
proper form and at the appropriate time, the fiscal officer shall promptly
search for and produce for inspection the same and he shall, upon payment of
the established fee, make a copy of the record for him. (d) The fiscal officer shall respond promptly
to a request for the payroll record and his response shall be made no more than
five workdays after receipt of the request for inspection. Notes
